intro: Chaetospora umbellulifera, commonly known as the umbrella-shaped liverwort, is a type of non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its rosette-like growth pattern and the presence of small, leaf-like structures called phyllodes. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as archegonia, are located on the underside of the leaves. Chaetospora umbellulifera plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
